headline: Chicken and Pasta Casserole with Mixed Vegetables
description: This creamy chicken pasta casserole is easy to make with lots of vegetables; great comfort food for chilly evenings and will please the whole family!

video.description: Try this hearty noodle casserole with chicken tenders and vegetables.
video.name: Chicken and Pasta Casserole with Mixed Vegetables

name: Chicken and Pasta Casserole with Mixed Vegetables
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Lightly grease a medium baking dish.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook fusilli in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 10 to 12 minutes.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add chicken; season with minced onion, basil, parsley, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Cook and stir until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear. Stir in fusilli pasta, cream of chicken soup, cream of mushroom soup, and mixed vegetables. Transfer to the prepared baking dish.
Mix bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, and butter together in a small bowl; sprinkle evenly over the casserole.
Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly and lightly browned, 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I added a can of mushrooms, and used thighs. turned out great and was easy to do.
Shrimp instead of chicken, o/w made as directed except several more spices and mozzarella cheese

I thought this was pretty good, but would require a few modifications to be a keeper. Others suggested that this would benefit from additional soup or milk; I added 1/4 cup milk and found the dish to be plenty creamy and moist. The chicken ended up being a bit dry, and I would maybe use thighs next time, which will better endure the dual stove top/oven cooking. Finally, the frozen veggie combo (corn, peas, green beans, and carrots) just didn't do it for me for this particular dish. I would try using sauteed mushrooms and green beans. I would also add a little bit of cayenne pepper.
My daughter made this for her choice of her online cooking class during the Pandemic. It was AMAZING

This recipe comes together fairly quickly. No fancy ingredients, it's simple ingredients that are probably in your pantry and spice rack. I used cellantani instead of fussili. It's tasty and easy to make. A double win.
I was a little hesitant about the tablespoon of basil, but I shouldn't have been. This was very good. I added a half-soup can of milk to address the comments about it being dry.
We, my family ,like this recipe very much and I will be making it again. Good too because you can put in what ever veggies you like.
Great inspiration! I used chicken, fresh mushroom, broccoli, onion, garlic, greens… cream of mushroom and chicken… and topped it with CORNBREAD STUFFING!!!! uuuuhhhh yum

I made this for a friend who had just had a baby. It was easy to make and had an elevated taste from all the chicken casseroles I have made before. 
I been make it ever since!
Changed it up a bit. Used fresh onion and replaced the mixed veggies with fresh broccoli and mushrooms. Made extra of the breadcrumb/parm mixture.
OOOOMMMMGGGGG!!! This is AMAZING!!! Wish I'da found this earlier n my life. Prefect. Just follow the directions to a T & you'll b amazed like I am. Bravo
I made this exactly as the recipe states and it was SO good. My 3 year old twins and 12 year old loved it and cleaned their plates bare!

Absolutely wonderful. Didn’t have cream of mushroom soup so I used two cans of cream of chicken soup and added a small can of sliced mushrooms. Also added some milk as others suggested. While we were eating my husband says “you’ve got to make this again”! Just the two of us and we almost ate the entire 6 servings in one meal.

The taste was amazing! The only thing for me was that it wasn’t thick enough and wasn’t very casserole like. It tasted a lot like chicken pot pie without the crust but I would still eat it again! It was fun to make :)
This was suprisingly good. I think I might shred the chicken next time, and I might make a little more of the topping. But this was pretty good.
I added a cup of sour cream based on other reviews and it turned out wonderful. I also used fresh onions and garlic instead of powder. Very tasty.

This recipe was not to my taste as written. The 1 cup of breadcrumbs alone was so much it nearly killed the dish. Next time I make this I will cut the crumbs at least in half and I think I will sub and use 2 cans of cream of celery instead...
I did make this recipe just as is and it was wonderful! I also made it with a box of stuffing added to the top instead of the breadcrumbs. Great recipe!!!!
I thought it was good except for the bread crumbs.
I didn’t have bread crumbs so I used crushed up Ritz crackers. Per previous comments, I also added some milk to the mix. It came out so good. Would definitely make again
Very simple, very tasty. I added cream cheese and milk instead of 2nd can of condensed soup. I cooked fresh cut veggies instead of frozen. Everybody loved it.
It was tasty, but a little dry. Maybe should add a little more soup.
Excellent! Only made minor changes. I used 2 cans of cream of chicken, I didn’t have mushroom in hand. I also added ~1/2 can of milk per several suggestions. Turned out great, kids approved too!
Very easy and good taste
I have made this recipe quite a bit since finding it and I always follow it exactly. A lot of the reviews say it was too dry but I never have a problem with that. This makes for great leftovers too.

Made tonight for supper. Unfortunately I did not read reviews before and it was dry. And I did not have the cream of chicken soup and subbed cream of celery. Also I think there was too much bread crumbs. So I was disappointed in the meal; however, I will make again with the right ingredients and some added fluids.

This was a hit! I used 2 cups pasta instead of 1, two cans cream of chicken soup instead of cream of mushroom.. added a little less than a cup of cream, and a little less than a cup of sharp cheddar. I also used shake n bake, mixed with Parmesan cheese, and 4 tbsp of melted butter for the topping mixed with some salt, pepper, a little garlic powder and Italian seasoning.. and it was nice and crispy which added a wonderful texture. It turned out delicious! Will definitely make again...and again...

This is so delicious!! I did go by other recommendations and I added another can of condensed cream of mushroom, the whole bag of mixed veggies (about double the amount) and some milk. It turned out delicious, and even though this is a winter dish, we wanted to change things up, and did not regret it!!

Used leftover rotisserie chicken. For the mixed veg, I sauteed onion, mushrooms, garlic,and fresh spinach that needed to be used up. Tossed in 675g of frozen tortellini. Oh and I added a cup of sour cream for a creamier sauce to cook the tortellini in! If I hadn't sauteed the veg, this casserole would have taken about 5 minutes to assemble with the leftover chicken and frozen tortellini, frozen broccoli? Thanks for this versatile and easy recipe!
We followed the recipe exactly and this turned out delicious. Leftovers reheat great and can be frozen too. We can’t wait to have it again!!
I really liked this dish really easy. However next time I make it I think I will us caned mixed veggies and skip the bread. I the the caned Erie’s

Family didn’t love it. Because of previous reviews stating it was a little dry, I did add a little sour cream & milk. I hate when people rate a recipe after changing it around but I only did due to other complaints. Will move on from this one.

Great casserole. I used one can of cream of chicken soup and 2 cans of cream of mushroom soup. Next time I make it I want to try putting french fries onions on top instead of bread crumbs. This recipe is really easy to modify.
I followed the (easy peasy) recipe exactly, except I had to substitute macaroni for fusilli. Loved the result. So nice to whip up a hearty, tasty meal in under an hour with ingredients on hand!
Improvised with the veggies, but this turned out great. Thanks!

First, the recipe calls for “1 cup” pasta but I suspect it should read 1 pound, the typical measure of a box of pasta. We used 3 cubs (3/4 pound) but followed the rest of the ingredient list measurements as-is and flavors and consistency all came out nicely. Other reviewers mention adding cream/milk for creamier consistency and I agree if you want a bit of sauce on the plate, but we didn’t add anything and like the not-saucy noodle-chicken-crumb topping texture. The crumb topping is the clincher for this dish.
I loved it. I used the recipe as it is and the result was a tasty dish!

This is a great basic recipe. I made it the first time pretty much as is in a pinch when a friend was sick and needed a meal, just substituted frozen broccoli for the frozen mixed vegetables. I used rotini pasta because I couldn't find fusilli. I've made it for us a few times since and made some other adjustments. I used about a 1/2 cup of diced onion and 3 medium minced garlic cloves instead of the dried minced onion and sauteed it until opaque before adding the chicken, herbs, and seasonings to the pan to cook. I added 8 oz. sliced crimini mushrooms that I had sauteed separately with a small amount of butter and garlic powder with the remaining ingredients. I stirred in about 1/4 to 1/3 cup of chicken broth to the mixture before baking for extra moisture. I also halved the bread crumb mixture and found it was plenty for us.

This recipe is awesome! It is one of my family’s favorite! It’s super simple and it’s one of those meals I can make the night before and have my husband put in the oven before I get home. Instead of one can of mushroom soup and cream of chicken I do two cans of mushroom/cream of chicken combined. I also add a 1/4 of milk to make it extra creamy.

I made this for my grandkids and they loved it so much they went back for seconds. I did make a few changes. I used 8 oz pasta, used fresh onions - sautéed. I placed the chicken in just enough water to cover, sprinkled with garlic powder, salt and pepper and cooked until just done (approx 5 min) I removed chicken to cool (reserving broth)before cutting into bite size pieces. I combined the ingredients plus a cup of sour cream along with soups and used Italian seasoning instead of basil and parsley. I used broth as needed to make sure pasta mixture was good and moist. It was so good. We liked the crunchy topping too.
Good flavor but the chicken got too tough from cooking it beforehand then cooking for 30min in the oven. I might use meat from a rotisserie chicken next time or maybe use dark meat.
I had left over chicken breasts in the refrigerator, but my kids hate eating the same meal twice in a week. This was the perfect recipe! They loved it!
I thought this would be better but it’s honestly kinda salty and mushy. I wouldn’t make it again.
Very good
I made this, loved it. I did mix in 1 cup of Mozzarella cheese into the mix, then topping it with Parmesan cheese.

I used the advice of some of the other reviews and added more cream of chicken. I accidentally poured too many breadcrumbs in the mixture of butter and Parmesan but it turned out ok. I will definitely make it again and maybe use crumbled butter crackers and perhaps more salt.

I used 2 cups of dry rotini noodles, added about 6 oz. of sour cream, and a tiny splash of beer to the bread crumbs. I also used a steamer bag of frozen mixed vegetables for time and convenience. Definitely will make again! Picky husband and toddler approved!
My husband asks me to make this for him every week now! I used crushed Ritz crackers on top instead of the breadcrumbs and I think it makes it crispier. Thanks for this recipe.
This was a lot of steps and a lot of dishes for something pretty mediocre. I’d cut back on the breadcrumbs, too.

Amazing! Followed directions exactly except I added a 1/2 of cup of milk as some reviews suggested. Also, cooked at 350 degrees versus 400 as I suspect this is the reason the recipe was ‘dry’ for some users. Lastly, I broiled on 350 degrees the last 2-5 mins to ensure the crust was brown enough. Will definitely make again.

Just popped this dish out of the oven! It smells heavenly! AND, I made it entirely GLUTEN FREE! Cut up 2 large chicken breasts, used 2 dry cups of GF penne rigate, 2 cans of Progresso GF cream of mushroom soup, used same spices for cooking chicken plus added some Mrs Dash’s Italian Medley seasoning. The Progresso soup has more liquid than a condensed soup. I added sour cream, a little shredded pepper jack & sharp cheddar cheeses. Poured it into baking dish. Took GF multigrain bread & ran it through food processor for crumbs, then mixed it with butter & Parmesan/Romano cheese & spread it on top. Baked 30 minutes @ 400. My husband loved it....it was delicious!! This is certain to become a favorite! Thank you for the recipe.

We liked it! Husband and picky 5 year old grandson approved. I substituted what I had on hand, chicken thighs and extra wide fiber egg noodles. 1 can cream of mushroom, 1 can cream of broccoli, 1 can milk. Potato chips and cheddar cheese on top! Delicious, thanks for the receipe!??
I made it exactly as the recipe said and it was ok. I think it has too much parsley. overall pretty good.
I made this meal exactly by the recipe that was given and this was sooo delicious . My whole family loved this it reminded them of a chicken pot pie . I would make this again!

Keeper!! I made it nearly exact to recipe. I didn't have frozen veggies so I put in a drained can of sweet corn - worked just fine. I think I will halve the bread crumbs next time as they were a little dry and took some pushing around the plate to moisten up. But this is GREAT! And it should freeze well for nights I get home and just do NOT want to cook. :) Thanks for a great recipe Jen - keep 'em comin'!!
I made the recipe as-is. It was very bland.
delicious!!! new house favorite!!

I increased the amount of chicken and pasta because I felt it would be too soupy. It still came out very thick and creamy.
 To be very honest though, I did not really like the taste of it, but my 3 year old devoured her entire plate and my husband could take it or leave it. he said it reminded him of hospital food. He still ate it though, lol!
 Giving it 3 stars because my picky toddler ate it without complaint.
Not as great as I was hoping :(

I would give this recipe 3 stars if made as it is written due to the dryness. Even using the recommendations of other reviews to add milk, it is still dry, especially if you reheat leftovers. To fix this, in addition to adding a cup of milk, only add half off the breadcrumbs. To add a little more flavor, you can also drizzle a about 1/4 cup ranch dressing to the breadcrumb topping.

We made this for dinner tonight. Based on the other reviews, I added 2 cans of milk to create a sauce with the soups. I think 1 can would have been enough. :) But, we followed the rest of the recipe as instructed and it is delicious! I will definitely make it again, especially when the cold weather returns. This will be a great comfort food. :)

I thought this recipe was very easy to follow and also easy to make changes where needed. And I did make a few changes. I substituted 1 1/2 cups of Penne for the fusilli pasta. I used 2 cans of Campbell's Heathy Request Cream of Mushroom soup instead of the 1 cream of chicken and 1 cream of mushroom soups. Instead of mixed vegetables, I used 1 cup of canned carrot slices drained, and 1 cup of canned cut green beans drained. I didn't have the dried minced onion so I used onion powder, about 1 tsp. And I didn't have the dried parsley so I omitted it. Neither myself or my husband like breadcrumb toppings on casseroles so I didn't do that part of the recipe. We both thought the casserole tasted great, and he even asked for a second helping! Next time I make this, I am thinking of adding shredded mild cheddar cheese to the top the last 10 minutes of baking. I definitely will be adding this recipe to my favorites! Thank you JENTOP!
It was ate up in record breaking time.
I mixed in about a cup of shredded mozzarella.Everyone loved it!

this recipe was pretty good and easy to make, the only thing I did different was add a cup of half and half, it was so thick with the condensed soup that you couldn't hardly mix it. Next time I will use 2 cups so its more creamy. The bread topping needs to be cut in about half way too much topping.
I used shredded cheddar cheese instead of Parmesan cheese.

This was great! It definitely needs a 3rd can of cream of chicken/mushroom. To make it quicker, I used a rotisserie chicken. I subbed frozen broccoli and a can of (well-drained) italian diced tomatoes for the mixed veggies, but I'm sure it would be great with standard mixed vegetables.
Turned out very tasty
I think this turned out pretty tasty and it was super easy to make. My picky kids even ate it

Really love this recipe, but like pretty much every recipe I make it my own

2-3 cans mushroom soup
Brussel sprouts/peas/mushrms
Garlic salt/pepper/grd onion/grd garlic/montreal chkn spice

Mix cooked pasta and soup, add in chicken, then veggies.

Top with grated cheese, some pepper and garlic salt if desired. 

Spread crumb topping

This time I poured a bit of milk over mixture. Will decide if this was neccessary after. 

Cover.

Bake and then broil for one or two minutes.
Followed directions. Tasted it before baking; it seemed a little bland. I added soy sauce , sour cream, chicken broth, and topped it with cheddar cheese. Much tastier.
i gave it 4 stars because of the four of us that ate it 2 really liked it and 2 thought it was OK. It was tasty but nothing special. followed recipe but used cooked chicken. Will probably make again.
I read the reviews before I made it so I added a half soup can of milk and it was fine. Next time I will cut down on the breadcrumbs.

Just OK, mainly due to the frozen mixed veggies. Obviously that is a huge time saver, but also a flavor tanker as well IMO. Frozen corn is ok, but green beans and carrots from frozen are nothing like the non-frozen item. I wonder if throwing in some chopped carrots and uncooked green beans would work. Maybe sub out the green beans for something else altogether.

Very good. I used ~ 2 1/2 cups (dry)rotini pasta, 3 chicken breasts, chopped onion, 1tsp garlic and added mushrooms. I also added 1/2 can milk as recommended by others and the amount of liquid was perfect. I used my large oval casserole dish- perfect size.
Help! I made it but I forgot to put the mix vegetables in. ?? Is there a way I can fix that for the leftovers?
Pretty good! Only complaint is that its a tad too much basil. I used the low fat versions of the soups, and only one cup of breadcrumbs instead of 2. It was not dry at all as some have complained.
I made this with rotini instead of fusili, and ended up using 2 cups. The flavor is great!
Instead of frozen mixed vegetables I used a frozen broccoli, cauliflower and carrot blend. The casserole was very good. I will use this recipe again.

Made this for my wife and 11 year old and it was a hit. I used 2 cups of penne pasta. Substituted minced dried onion for onion powder. Substituted cream of celery for the mushroom soup. Added a splash of 2% milk to each corner before baking.
Awesome recipe it foes needs more liquid though i used some sour cream and milk.

I wanted something tasty, easy, and not loaded with pasta or cheese. This was really good considering how easy it was to make. I used frozen broccoli and cauliflower, diced the chicken into large chunks since I had whole breasts, added half a can of milk, and used Italian bread crumbs. It came together quickly and will make really good leftovers.
Not the worst thing I've eaten
So delicious! I think I’ll add a third can next time to make it a little more creamy. And a little less breadcrumbs. Overall, great dish!
I’ve been making a version of this for years. I used noodles & added a bag of frozen mixed vegetables. Topped with crushed ritz cracker & butter before baking.

I used 2.5 cups of noodles. 3 tablespoons of oil was too much and made things very greasy, would only use 2 tablespoons in the future.
I made it expecting it to be a main dish but in the future I would make it as a side dish.
Surprisingly easy and tasted great. Both of my kids loved this.
Dry and bland, even after adding 1/2c sour cream & 1/2c milk.

I actually made this quite a few months ago but forgot to rate it. I used leftover rotisserie chicken as it needed to be used up. Other than that I made it pretty much as written. I could tell that it might need some liquid as it seemed a bit on the dry side and other reviews agreed. Next time I'll add a half can or so of milk or some FF sour cream or Greek yogurt. Aside from that, the flavor was very good and it was easy to put together. I'll definitely be making this again.
I modified the recipe; sauté chicken with fresh basil, parsley, garlic, and a chopped onions. I’ll made it again, very tasty.
This was a very simple recipe. I think the next time I make this casserole
This was delicious and pretty easy! I listened to some of the commentators recommendations and included fresh mushrooms as well. I also did fresh onions instead of dried. Would definitely make again!
Family really liked it! I did add more pasta and the milk as suggested.

this was a delicious dish. perfect for a rainy day...and super easy to make. absolutely no leftovers, and definitely a recipe I'd make again!!! I only had cream of chicken on hand tho (would love to try it next time w the cream of mushroom too)
I made this exactly and I had no problems! The only thing I did differently, was broiled the top til brown and baked for maybe 5 minutes. It was not dry as others had stated! It was really good.
I used 2 cups of dry rotini .

It's an ok casserole. I've followed this recipe almost to the T except didn't have parsley on hand and instead of parmesan cheese I used an old cheddar cheese as that's all I had on hand. 
I would make it again as it's not that expensive to make and it doesn't take a long time to prepare it but maybe less dried onion next time as that's all I'm tasting kinda overpowering.

I liked it and I will be making it again. I used sour cream and half and half as other reviewers suggested. I also left out the addition of butter to the topping mixture, but next time I'll probably incorporate. All in all it was pretty quick and delicious.
I usually follow the directions and it comes out great every time. But this time I substituted rice for the pasta and only used half of the parsley. I think I like it this way better

item.name: Chicken and Pasta Casserole with Mixed Vegetables
